edu.harvard.cs262.DistributedGame

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    Game is an interface that is implemented by every game so that it can interact with the client and server system.
    Version:
    1.0, April 2014
    Author:
    Twitch Plays Battleship Group

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long executeCommand(GameCommand command)
      Updates the state of the game by executing the passed-in command
      GameSnapshot getSnapshot()
      Gets the current snapshot from the server to send back to the client
      GameState getState()
      Gets an update of the current game state to sent to other servers.
      boolean setState(GameState gamestate)
      Sets the state of the game to the passed-in game state

    • Method Detail

      • getSnapshot

        GameSnapshot getSnapshot()
        Gets the current snapshot from the server to send back to the client
        Returns:
        A GameSnapshot that represents the current snapshot of the game

      • getState

        GameState getState()
        Gets an update of the current game state to sent to other servers. The contents of GameState could be either a game state or a full log, depending on the game.
        Returns:
        A GameState that represents the current state of the game.

      • setState

        boolean setState(GameState gamestate)
        Sets the state of the game to the passed-in game state
        Parameters:
        gamestate - A GameState that represents the current state of the game
        Returns:
        A boolean that represents whether the gamestate was properly set

      • executeCommand

        long executeCommand(GameCommand command)
        Updates the state of the game by executing the passed-in command
        Parameters:
        command - A GameCommand that represents the command to be executed
        Returns:
        A long that represents the new frame number of the game following the execution of the command
